Package charts

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    IChartViewListener
    This interface contains methods that are called by chart frames in response to user actions.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Alarm
    Represents an alarm price.
    AlarmsDialog
    Alarms Dialogs can be opened by the user from the menu bar of a chart frame.
    BollingerBands
    Represents a Bollinger Bands stock chart indicator.
    Candle
    Represents a stock chart candle.
    CandleDataResponse
    Represents a data provider's response to a request for candle data.
    ChartController
    Represents the controller of a chart window according to the Model-View-Controller paradigm.
    ChartDataStorageForPersistence
    The data of each chart frame that needs to be persisted when the program closes in order to be able to restore the chart frame, is stored in an instance of this class.
    ChartFrame
    Objects of this class are internal frames that house charts chart panels, which in turn draw charts.
    ChartFrameMenuBar
    Every chart frame contains an instance of this class as its menu bar.
    ChartModel
    Instances of this class act as the models for the chart views.
    ChartPanel
    Instances of this class are contained in chart frames and form the drawing surfaces for charts and stock data.
    CustomDate
    Instances of this class provide custom formated date strings derived from a unix timestamp in milliseconds.
    HttpQueryMaker
    This utility class contains a static method to make a REST http query to the provided URL and receive a String as response.
    Indicator
    The abstract parent class of the indicators.
    IndicatorsDialog
    Represents the dialog that can be opened from the menu bar of a chart frame, where the user defines and creates indicators to be shown in the chart.
    MovingAverage
    Instances of this class store data for calculating Moving Average type indicators.
    StaticCandleDataRequester
    This class contains a static method for requesting candle data from a data provider.
    WindowsMenuChartItem
    Represents an item in the Windows menu of the main frame menu bar.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    AlarmType
    This enum type is used in the Alarm class to define whether an alarm threshold price is a lower or an upper bound, in order to decide whether it is to be triggered when the stock price crosses from below or from above.
    IndicatorTypes
    This enumeration defines constants for the indicator types, which are used to decide how to calculate and render an indicator in a chart.
    Intervals
    The constants in this enumeration identify a chart interval.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    TooManyIntervalsException
    Exceptions of this type are thrown by the chart model when the user requests more data points than the data provider provides.
